question: Dade?
answer: Yeah, mom?

question: What are you doing?
answer: I'm taking over a TV network.

question: Security, uh Norm, Norm speaking.
answer: Norman? This is Mr. Eddie Vedder, from Accounting. I just had a power surge here at home that wiped out a file I was working on. Listen, I'm in big trouble, do you know anything about computers?

question: Uhhmmm... uh gee, uh...
answer: Right, well my BLT drive on my computer just went AWOL, and I've got this big project due tomorrow for Mr. Kawasaki, and if I don't get it in, he's gonna ask me to commit Hari Kari...

question: Uhhh.. ahahaha...
answer: Yeah, well, you know these Japanese management techniques. Could you, uh, read me the number on the modem?

question: Uhhhmm...
answer: It's a little boxy thing, Norm, with switches on it... lets my computer talk to the one there... Yak yak yak. Get a job! Yesssss! Hey! What? No, wait. Unbelievable. A hacker! Yeah, okay "Acid Burn", that's enough. Shit on me!

question: It's a little boxy thing, Norm, with switches on it... lets my computer talk to the one there... Yak yak yak. Get a job! Yesssss! Hey! What? No, wait. Unbelievable. A hacker! Yeah, okay "Acid Burn", that's enough. Shit on me!
answer: Good morning. You unpack your stuff yet?

question: Mm-hmm.
answer: Up all night again, huh?

question: Can this wait until both my eyes are open, please?
answer: Can I cut the electricity to his room so he'll sleep normal hours? He's been playing with his computer all night for a solid week. Well yes, he could be playing with himself. Mmm hmm. Yes I'll ask. Dade, you like girls, don't you?

question: Well, yeah, I just haven't found one as charming as you yet.
answer: You haven't been doing anything stupid, right, Dade? Right, Dade?!

question: Right, mom. And I'm still a virgin!
answer: You hooked it up to the phone, didn't you? Dade! Turn the shower off! You screw up again and you won't get into college! I'm sorry we had to move in your senior year. I didn't want to sell the house but I had to take this new job, you know that. You're going to love New York, it's the city that never sleeps!

question: Excuse me. Yeah, I'm sorry, I was just looking for the principal's office.
answer: Do you have your transfer forms? It's a relatively straightforward question. Do you speak English?

question: Sorry, you wanted...?
answer: I wanted transfer forms. Thank you. Are you coming? The gym is through there, and the cafeteria is through there.

question: Great. Cool. What's your name?
answer: Kate. Kate Libby.

question: Here's your class.
answer: My... class. You mean I'm not in your class?

question: No, you're not in my class.
answer: Give me time! Yeah. Pool?

question: Yeah, there's an Olympic size swimming pool up on the roof. Take the stairs over there.
answer: Yeah! Sure. Thanks!

question: The Phantom Phreak? The king of Nynex? I know you play the game.
answer: Phreakphreakphreakphreakphreak, dudedudedudedudedudedude... I gotta...

question: Joey, Joey...
answer: What? whatwhatwhat?

question: One more "dude" out of you and I'm gonna slap the shit outa you, okay? Now I'm trying to save you from yourself but you gotta stop letting your mama dress you, man!
answer: I need a handle, man. I don't have an identity until I have a handle.

question: You know, you're right about that. Check it, Friday.
answer: Alright. How about the Master of Disaster, huh?

question: You're hopeless, man, utterly hopeless.
answer: Ultra Laser. Doctor Doom!

question: I'll give it a shot.
answer: Is this kid bothering you, Kate?

question: Sorry, can I get some room here?
answer: Yeah. Why don't you come up here? He's good!

question: Well, it looks like I'm on top.
answer: Congratulations. No one's ever beat her before. You just made an enemy for life. Boy meets world. Let's go?

question: Who's that?
answer: Curtis.

question: And what's he do?
answer: That's it, you're looking at it, he just looks slick all day. What's up? Oh my God. You... Way cool! You saw that?

question: Well, he's on my list. "Of all the things I've lost, I miss my mind the most?"
answer: Ozzy Osbourne!

question: You. What is your name?
answer: Uh, Emmanuel Goldstein, sir?

question: You, however, are not on my list.
answer: Whoa, this isn't wood shop class?

question: How was school?
answer: Hmmm.

question: What did we learn in school today?
answer: Revenge.

question: Aaaah. Did we meet someone special?
answer: No. No one special.

question: Okay, I gotta get back to work. I'm gonna be home late. And would you try and please fill these out? Oh don't worry, it's only the rest of your life.
answer: Right. Anything else, you want me to mow the lawn? Oops, forgot. New York. No grass.

question: International Unix Environments.
answer: Luscious orange?

question: Computer security criteria, DOD standards. The Pink Shirt Book, Guide to IBM PCs. So called due to the nasty pink shirt the guy wears on the cover.
answer: What's that?

question: Devil book. The Unix Bible.
answer: What's that?

question: Dragon book. Compiler design.
answer: Oh yeah? What's that?

question: Mr. Belford?
answer: My name is the Plague.

question: Uh, Mr. The Plague, uh, something weird's happening on the net.
answer: As in what, you hapless techno-weenie?

question: That's right, this IS a payphone.
answer: As you can see, this is just a simple microcassette recorder. Hook it up to the phone and drop in five bucks in quarters.

question: Record the tones that the coins make. And hang up and get your money back!
answer: And never again have to pay for a service that would be dirt cheap...

question: ...IF it weren't run by a bunch of profiteering gluttons!
answer: Remember, hacking is more than just a crime. It's a survival trait!

question: How's it going, Ray?
answer: It looks good, sir. We've got an uncorrupted hard drive.

question: In English, please. I didn't spend ten years protecting the president so I could finish my career feeling like an idiot.
answer: I'm sorry, sir. We caught him by surprise, so we don't think he had time to erase his computer files.

question: Good. Good man. Alright, let's finish up here, and take him in for interrogation.
answer: Alright sir.

question: Good morning, Gentlemen. Please be seated. I see we're still dressing in the dark, Eugene.
answer: Once again, don't call me Eugene. A recent unknown intruder penetrated, using a superuser acount, giving him access to our whole system.

question: Precisely what you're paid to prevent.
answer: Someone didn't bother reading my carefully prepared memo on commonly used passwords. Now, as I so meticulously pointed out, the for most used passwords are love, sex, secret and... ...God. So would your holiness care to change her password? A hacker planted the virus.

question: Virus?
answer: Yesterday, the ballast program for a supertanker training model mistakenly thought the vessel was empty, and flooded its tanks.

question: Excuse me?
answer: The little boat flipped over. A virus planted in the Gibson computer system claimed responsibility.

question: What, it left a note?
answer: That is the virus. Leonardo da Vinci. The problem is we have twenty six ships at sea and we don't know which ones are infected. There's no such thing anymore, Duke. These ships are totally computerized. They rely on satellite navigation, which links them to our network, and the virus, wherever they are in the world.

question: So what are we supposed to do?
answer: Well luckily, you have a gifted and talented security officer. I traced the hacker's call. The secret service picked him up this morning. I'll just search his files for the original virus code, and then I can eliminate it. Yeah! Well, we're working on it as fast as we can. This is a very common occurrence in corporations as large as ours. You have nothing to worry about. Yeah, the Secret Service is helping us out 100 percent. Okay? We'll be in touch. Talk to you later.

question: What the hell was that all about?
answer: I had to move fast. The hacker copied my garbage file.

question: What?
answer: I created Mister da Vinci so we could call in the Secret Service. So they'd arrest the hacker, sieze his equipment, things that we can't do on our own.

question: I don't want to go to jail for this.
answer: Relax. Think about the 25 million dollars.

question: But you've created a virus that's going to cause a worldwide ecological disaster, just to arrest some hacker kid?
answer: Basically, uhmm, yeah. Mmm hmmm.

question: Jesus. You know, you're sick, Eugene. You...
answer: Sh, sh sh sh sh. I'll take care of this. I can cancel it any time. I don't need any program code. But it's the perfect cover, to confiscate the disc and find out how much of that garbage file has been copied.

question: Listen to this bullshit. "This is our world now. The world of the electron and the switch, the beauty of the baud. We exist without nationality, skin color, or religious bias. You wage wars, murder, cheat, lie to us and try to make us believe it's for our own good, yet we're the criminals. Yes, I am a criminal. My crime is that of curiosity. I am a hacker and this is my manifesto." Huh, right, manifesto? "You may stop me, but you can't stop us all."
answer: Now that's cool.

question: Cool?
answer: Yeah, cool.

question: You think it's cool?
answer: It's cool!

question: Don't move!
answer: Christ! What is the...

question: Shut up!
answer: What are you doing, man? Get off me!

question: Gill. Loser. I can't believe you were only eleven when you wrote this. It's quite an impressive virus. Dade, I know how you might feel about narking on your friends, but, we're hackers. For us, there's no such thing as family and friends. We're each our own country, with temporary allies and enemies. I'd like to make a treaty with you.
answer: I'm sorry. Who are you?

question: I'm the one who understands you. Now, can we be allies?
answer: Nah. I don't play well with others. Shit! Come on!

question: Watch which friends you do play with. A record like yours could land you in jail, get you kicked out of school, no colleges would take you. No future. Exiled from everyone and everything you love. I'll be in touch. I'm fine. Oh, and Dade, try to stay out of trouble, okay?
answer: Blow me.

question: Murphy kid turn you down?
answer: I disguised myself as an Alabama State Trooper and penetrated the FBI NCIC.

question: Pervert! What are you talking about?
answer: The FBI computer holds files on twenty million Americans. I just hacked into it.

question: Congratulations.
answer: From here I got access to every piece of data ever stored on Dade Murphy's parents. His parents separated five years ago, reconciled two years later, filed for divorce last year, custody battle, boy chose to go with his mother. Hmm.

question: So?
answer: So, we get the mother, we get the boy.

question: What the hell are you doing?
answer: It's cool, I'm just looking.

question: It's too much machine for you.
answer: Yeah?

question: I hope you don't screw like you type.
answer: It has a killer refresh rate.

question: P6 chip. Triple the speed of the Pentium.
answer: Yeah. It's not just the chip, it has a PCI bus. But you knew that.

question: Indeed. RISC architecture is gonna change everything.
answer: Yeah. RISC is good. You sure this sweet machine's not going to waste?

question: Crash Override. What was it. "Mess with the Best, Die Like the Rest?"
answer: Yeah.

question: Are you challenging me?
answer: Name your stakes.

question: If I win, you become my slave.
answer: Your slave?

question: You wish. You'll do shit work, scan, crack copyrights, whatever I want.
answer: And if I win?

question: Make it my first born.
answer: Make it our first date.

question: You're not gonna win.
answer: And you have to smile.

question: Right. If I win, you wear a dress on our date.
answer: And if I win, so do you.

question: Deal.
answer: Oooohhhh... Dade. I didn't know your size, so I guessed. You are man enough to stick with the deal, aren't you?

question: Yo, what's up?
answer: Dude dude dude, I gotta talk to you a minute, listen listen listen. I copied a garbage file from...

question: Big deal. A garbage file's got shit in it, Joey, come on.
answer: Nono, it's like hot or something. I don't know.

question: Joey, a garbage file holds miscellaneous data. Junk. Bits of stuff that's been erased, man.
answer: I copied it from Ellingson, okay? They're asking me about it, alright? Will you take a look for me?

question: Oh shit, Joey, you've got a tail.
answer: Shit!

question: What are you waiting for, arrest me already!
answer: Hello, operator services.

question: Hello, operator? I'm having trouble dialing a number.
answer: What number please? Just one moment.

question: Thank you.
answer: Hello?

question: Hey, it's me.
answer: Phreak?

question: I'm freaking! Joey wasn't making it up! He really hacked into Ellingson! He gave me the disc with a file he copied and now I'm in jail! They're charging me with some serious shit! And there's stuff I didn't even do, like inserting some virus called Da Vinci, and they keep asking about you guys.
answer: You think they're going to bust us?

question: The girl. The girl has the disc I need.
answer: I told you, I don't play well with others.

question: Turn on your laptop. Set it to receive a file. Lauren Murphy is now a wanted felon in the state of Washington. Forgery, Embezzlement, two drug convictions, plus she jumped parole. When she's arrested, she will not have a trial, she will not pass go, she will go directly to jail. Then I change this file back to the original, and your mom disappears.
answer: That's bullshit.

question: What can I tell you. Computers never lie, kid. Your mom will be arrested at work, she'll be handcuffed, and later, strip searched.
answer: You lay a finger on her and I'll kill you.

question: Kid, don't threaten me. There are worse things than death and, uh, I can do all of them! Talk to me.
answer: I got it. But listen, Kate didn't know what's on it. I mean, she came to me to figure it out. She's not the one who planted the virus. You leave her alone.

question: Hey, don't worry, kid. If she's innocent, she'll be fine. Your mommy's safe now, okay?
answer: Kate, listen.

question: It nibbles. You see this? This is every financial transaction Ellingson conducts, yeah? From million dollar deals to the ten bucks some guy pays for gas.
answer: The worm eats a few cents from each transaction.

question: And no one's caught it because the money isn't really gone. It's just data being shifted around.
answer: Right. And when the worm's ready, it zips out with the money and erases its tracks.

question: Joey got cut off before he got to that part. Check it out. By this point, it's already running at, what, twice the speed as when it started.
answer: Right, and at this rate it ends its run in...

question: Whoever wrote this needs somebody to take the fall. And that's Phreak, and that's Joey, and that's us. We've got to get the rest of the file, so we can find out where the money is going before the worm disappears, so we can find out WHO created it.
answer: I know, I know who wrote it.

question: What?
answer: This Ellingson security creep. I gave him a copy of the disc you gave me.

question: You what?
answer: I didn't know what was on it.

question: They had a large chunk of the garbage file? How much do they know?
answer: Not everything. But enough to implicate us.

question: You said the worm was untreaceable!
answer: Yeah. To civilians. But they're hackers. But don't worry. All we have to do is launch the Da Vinci virus, and then they'll all be put away.

question: Launch the Da Vinci virus? You can't do that!
answer: No one believes the guilty. Besides, by the time they realize the truth, we'll be long gone with all of our money. Look, there is no right and wrong. There is only fun and boring. A thirty year prison sentence sounds pretty dull to me. Who do you prefer serves it, us? Or them? The virus goes off tomorrow morning at 10:30, and those hackers tried to get into our system again. At this point I insist you take more strenuous action, or Ellingson Mineral will hold the Secret Service responsible.

question: Yo. I'm blowing up. It's Kate, Grand Central. Let's hit it! Hey Joey, you made it!
answer: Now listen up, use your best viruses to buy us time, we have to get into Plague's file and copy the worm.

question: Ai! Boom boom aiaiaiaiaee! Alright, that was a little tension breaker, that had to be done, alright?
answer: Cereal.

question: Yeah?
answer: Go fix the phones.

question: Roger.
answer: Joey, take his place.

question: It's replicating, eating up memory. What do I do?
answer: Type "Cookie", you idiot. I'll head 'em off at the pass.

question: We have a Zero Bug attacking all the login and overlay files.
answer: Run anti-virus. Give me a systems display! Die, dickweeds!

question: The rabbit is in the administration system.
answer: Send a Flu-shot.

question: Are you crazy? What are you doing?
answer: I'm trying to help you.

question: Dade.
answer: What?
